definition: to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
variant of 攀[pan1]
to pull/to turn (sth) around/to turn around (a situation)/to recoup
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: However, Massimo Ambronisi equalized in the 25th minute for Milan.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，安布罗西尼在25分钟为米兰扳平了比分。

sentences.english: Organised the defence, and scored Italy’s equaliser.
sentences.chinese: 组织起了本方的防守，并且打进了扳平比分的一球。

sentences.english: Gilberto replied immediately and the visitors came close to an equaliser.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔博托马上回敬一球，阿森纳一度接近扳平比分。

sentences.english: But I feel this team fights. We came back again against Boro and this team will go until the end.
sentences.chinese: 对阵米堡我们成功扳平，球队会战斗到最后一秒。

sentences.english: I prefer to remember Gilberto getting the equaliser, though!
sentences.chinese: 不过，我更愿意记住的是吉尔伯托扳平了比分。

sentences.english: Flatley kicked a penalty in the 97th minute, and the score drew level once again at 17-all.
sentences.chinese: 弗拉特里在第97分钟时一记罚球又将比分扳平。

sentences.english: When they equalised we were very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 当他们扳平时，我们非常紧张。

sentences.english: The outstanding moment, though, was the equalising goal.
sentences.chinese: 不过，不同凡响的那一刻发生在扳平比分时。

sentences.english: Chicago Ox team equalized two minutes before the end of the match.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥公牛队在比赛结束前两分钟扳平了比分。

sentences.english: Domoraud equalised, from Bunce 's excellent cross, after just three minutes.
sentences.chinese: 开场仅三分钟，多莫劳德接邦斯的妙传扳平了比分。

sentences.english: The host team equalize ten minutes later.
They showed that in the last 20 minuteswhen they really came at us trying for that equaliser.
sentences.chinese: 他们最后20分钟我看出仍然想扳平比分。

sentences.english: Beckham's classic pass helped the England team get an equalizer.
sentences.chinese: 碧咸的典型传球帮助英格兰扳平。

sentences.english: They cheered for the team when Mexico scored the equalizer, and all the pavilion seethed with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 当墨西哥队打入扳平一球时，馆内所有球迷为之疯狂。

sentences.english: But Iceland levelled the score two minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 两分钟之后，冰岛队扳平了比分。

sentences.english: Robbie Keane honoured the break equalised in the 49th minute and we had a real game on until that mad five minutes at the start of extra time.
sentences.chinese: 罗比基恩在第49分钟为热刺扳平了比分。

definition: score
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to score a goal/goal (sport)
penalty kick
(sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
own goal (ball sports)
half of a game or contest/half-court
free kick
(sports) overtime/extra time/play-off
(sports) injury time
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
to reverse (the score)/to pull off a comeback/to take the lead
end (of a performance or sports match)/last round of testing in the imperial examinations
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
to breach/to invade
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
